page.title: 09LOCAL NEWS IN GRAFFHAM
page.content: I saw a reporter for the Midhurst and Petworth Observer. It is part of the Portsmouth & Sunderland group to which all local papers belong. It has the most modern colour printing technology in the country. The stories are telephoned through and put onto a computer for editing. She works at home and reports on local events, features on interesting people called 'personality profiles', about their work or hobby. The information comes from noticeboards around the village, the church magazine, school newsletters and people who telephone her with information. She says that she plays a very small part in the production of the newspaper.
